alert.note: Alert for Columbia; Union (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 30 at 8:23PM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Union and northeastern Columbia Counties through 915 PM CDT... At 823 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Mount Holly, or 13 miles southwest of Smackover, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... El Dorado, Smackover, Norphlet, Calion, Village, Lisbon, Mount Holly, Urbana, Lawson, Ebenezer, Newell, New London, Pigeon Hill, Marysville, Cairo, Kenova, Spotville and Medlock. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for south central and southwestern Arkansas.
